article.headline: Michigan 59, Binghamton 46
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Michigan needed a little time to warm up before winning its season opener. Dion Harris scored 14 of his 16 points in the second half Monday night, and the Wolverines rallied from an early deficit for a 59-46 victory over Binghamton in the preseason NIT. Harris was just 1-for-5 in the first half as the Wolverines fell behind by 12 points and trailed 32-28 at intermission. "I thought we rushed things, we forced some shots and we were probably a little tight," Harris said. "We needed to calm down, and we did that." Daniel Horton led Michigan with 17 points. Michigan will host Colorado in the next round Wednesday night, with the winner earning a trip to New York for the semifinals. Colorado defeated College of Charleston 72-57 Monday night. Trailing 39-32, Michigan seized control on both ends of the floor with Brent Petway's slam dunk off an alley-oop pass from Harris giving the Wolverines a 41-39 lead with 12:35 to play. It was Michigan's first lead since Horton opened the game with a 3-point shot. Michigan went on a 21-2 run over a 12:05 span to overtake the Bearcats, who missed 18 consecutive shots from the field during the Wolverines' scoring spree. "Our defense obviously was tremendous for us," Michigan coach Tommy Amaker said. "A lot of things contributed to that run." Harris was one. The sophomore scored 12 of his points during the run, which came with Horton on the bench for most of it with four fouls. With Michigan leading by two, Harris scored seven consecutive points and went 4-for-4 from the free throw line to put Michigan up 50-41. "I thought Dion, especially when Daniel got into foul trouble, was our leader on the floor," Amaker said. Harris hit all six of his foul shots and Michigan was 21-for-23 on the night. The Bearcats went 4-for-26 from the field in the second half, missing 20 of their last 21 attempts. They scored only 14 points after intermission. "We got fatigued," Binghamton coach Al Walker said. "Michigan threw some different looks at us and we missed some shots we probably should have made."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
